congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 2396, to amend the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act to update the exception for certain annual notices provided by financial institutions, by a yea-and-nay vote of 275 yeas to 146 nays, Roll No. 682.<P/>Rejected the Maxine Waters (CA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 185 yeas to 235 nays, Roll No. 681.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

The House passed H.R. 2396, to amend the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act to update the exception for certain annual notices provided by financial institutions, by a yea-and-nay vote of 275 yeas to 146 nays, Roll No. 682.

The House passed H.R. 2396, to amend the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act to update the exception for certain annual notices provided by financial institutions, by a yea-and-nay vote of 275 yeas to 146 nays, Roll No. 682.<P/>Rejected the Maxine Waters (CA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 185 yeas to 235 nays, Roll No. 681.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

titleInfo.title: United States House Amendment Number 1 (115th Congress)
United States House Amendment Number 1 (115th Congress)
STRENGTHENING OVERSIGHT OF IRAN'S ACCESS TO FINANCE ACT

extension.searchTitle: STRENGTHENING OVERSIGHT OF IRAN'S ACCESS TO FINANCE ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 204

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Strengthening Oversight of Iran's Access to Finance Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4324, to require the Secretary of the Treasury to make certifications with respect to United States and foreign financial institutions' aircraft-related transactions involving Iran, by a yea-and-nay vote of 252 yeas to 167 nays, Roll No. 684. Consideration began yesterday, December 13th.<P/>Rejected the Swallwell (CA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 188 yeas to 233 nays, Roll No. 683. Consideration began yesterday, December 13th.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Strengthening Oversight of Iran's Access to Finance Act
Strengthening Oversight of Iran's Access to Finance Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4324, to require the Secretary of the Treasury to make certifications with respect to United States and foreign financial institutions' aircraft-related transactions involving Iran, by a yea-and-nay vote of 252 yeas to 167 nays, Roll No. 684. Consideration began yesterday, December 13th.

The House passed H.R. 4324, to require the Secretary of the Treasury to make certifications with respect to United States and foreign financial institutions' aircraft-related transactions involving Iran, by a yea-and-nay vote of 252 yeas to 167 nays, Roll No. 684. Consideration began yesterday, December 13th.<P/>Rejected the Swallwell (CA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 188 yeas to 233 nays, Roll No. 683. Consideration began yesterday, December 13th.
